trial_identification.studytitle: The role of peri-operative gabapentin in the management of pain following tonsillectomy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The role of gabapentin in the management of pain following tonsillectomy in all patients over 16 years old, compared with placebo, with pain being the primary outcome assessed.

interventions.interventions: A single pre-operative dose of oral gabapentin 600mg (capsule) given 30 minutes prior to induction with oral paracetamol 1g (tablet).
interventions.comparator: A single pre-operative dose of placebo given with paracetamol 1g.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The primary outcome measure is post-operative pain.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be assessed using a VAS, scoring at 2, 4, and 6 hours following surgery and on post-operative days 1 to 14.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary outcomes will be post-operative analgesic consumption.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be assessed on post-operative days 1 to 14 by way of a questionnaire and recovery of un-used analgesia at the end of the 2 week period.
Days 1-14 assessed by validated Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV) Intensity Scale.
Days 1-14 assessed by validated Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV) Intensity Scale.
Indication by non-validated questionnaire developed specifically for this study of day return to normal activity (From days 1-14).
Indication by non-validated questionnaire developed specifically for this study of day return to normal diet (From days 1-14).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Participants will be aged 16 years and over, scheduled for elective tonsillectomy between January 2014 and December 2014
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Exclusion criteria will include contraindications to gabapentin, other concurrent procedures, revision or unilateral tonsillectomy, inability to complete the scoring charts, and those with suspected malignancy.

trial_design.concealment: Patients who fit the inclusion criteria will approached and given information regarding the trial, if they wish to participate then fully informed consent will be obtained. Computer-allocated randomization will allocate participants to groups A or B, the coding for active and placebo will be kept at Dunedin Hospital Pharmacy.
trial_design.statisticalmethods: Local data regarding recovery following tonsillectomy, acquired at four different time periods, was used as the basis for a power analysis. Assuming (from that study) the estimated the standard deviation for pain scores will be about 2.4 and the correlation between the follow-up measures will be about 0.8, 40 participants (20 in each arm) will be sufficient to demonstrate a 25% difference in post-operative pain scores between the two groups. For this trial statistical tests will be performed at the two-sided 0.05 level of significance.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of the study is to assess whether gabapentin reduces post-operative pain after tonsillectomy compared to placebo. The study's hypothesis is that gabapentin reduces post-operative pain after tonsillectomy compared to placebo.
